title: Part G
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not provide both the correct choice and a valid justification equivalent to the following.

· Greater than. Since both elements are in the same row of the periodic table, their valence electrons occupy the same shell. However, since L has a substantially lower atomic mass than E, then L must also have a lower atomic number and therefore fewer protons in its nucleus. The valence electrons in L thus experience a weaker effective nuclear charge compared to E and are, on average, further from the nucleus because they are less strongly attracted.

The response provides both the correct choice and a valid justification equivalent to the following.

· Greater than. Since both elements are in the same row of the periodic table, their valence electrons occupy the same shell. However, since L has a substantially lower atomic mass than E, then L must also have a lower atomic number and therefore fewer protons in its nucleus. The valence electrons in L thus experience a weaker effective nuclear charge compared to E and are, on average, further from the nucleus because they are less strongly attracted.
